column4: hi all, hope someone can help me with an issue, i installed the 10.10 64bit, and i need to get the adobe flash player, can anyone help me on how to do that please
btw i had the last ubuntu on 64-bit, and somehow was able to get flash to work, or used something like it, now i can't remember how to do it for the 10.10 os
i've tried something similar with that link, but doesn't show the flashplugin64-installer.
i'll look, i'll do anything that lets me get flash player to work even if i have to use a different type of flash
i've found the second site you posted but for a different os, im using the new ubuntu and i need to make sure i get the exact one
you mean for maverick, but the link shows for lucid?
yes for Maverick Meerkat, the link is for a different version of ubuntu, for the exact same thing you gave me, i found the one for maverick
and haven't tried it yet, just about to try, just trying to see other ways
i depend on firefox, i need to use firefox for certain sites
plus the sites i've googled looked good, but i've been having problems with the ppa's
have you tried installing flash plugin for mozilla from the Applications > Ubuntu Software Center ?
yes still tells me i need to get an upgrade of adobe flash its actually a facebook game i know i some way got it to work on the previous ubuntu 64 os
sorry, i, myself use 32bit so, i couldn't help you more. :-/
well thats why i asked for anyone who can help with me. but thanks for the links.
